channel.title: What's your 2013 GOTY?
channel.description:
Mine is Bioshock Infinite. Sure, it has its fair share of flaws, but the world is beautiful and engrossing, and I think Irrational did a great job.
I'd put Brothers as a close second. It's the first time that I've seen story conveyed through controls. Seriously, if you haven't played it yet, don't miss it.
Honorable mention: Stanley Parable

Read full topic

item.title: What's your 2013 GOTY?
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
Dotard:

MP3 came out in 2012.

Topic, Bioshock Infinite as well, but I’m sure there’s much more I don’t currently recall thanks to a drink or two.
A good game imo is the one which story hooks you up right off the bat and can keep your interest to the very end.

I regret greatly that I haven’t finished Tomb Raider or even played much of it, but the characters are just so bland and forgettable (at the beginning at least, not sure how it develops over its course) I could finish Resident Evil 6 a game that’s hated and very low rated, yet I couldn’t do the same with the objectively better game.

I had pirated tomb raider when it originally came out because I wanted to see what all the fuss was about. Played about 40 minutes and found it appallingly boring, with bland cutscenes and too many-a QTE. I’ve since bought it when it went on sale and forced myself to keep going for a while longer and it’s gotten much better.

Read full topic

My vote goes to The Last of Us, followed by Bioshock Infinite, Tomb Raider, and maybe Max Payne 3.

MP3 came out in 2012.

Topic, Bioshock Infinite as well, but I’m sure there’s much more I don’t currently recall thanks to a drink or two.
A good game imo is the one which story hooks you up right off the bat and can keep your interest to the very end.

I regret greatly that I haven’t finished Tomb Raider or even played much of it, but the characters are just so bland and forgettable (at the beginning at least, not sure how it develops over its course) I could finish Resident Evil 6 a game that’s hated and very low rated, yet I couldn’t do the same with the objectively better game.

item.title: What's your 2013 GOTY?
item.dc:creator: Serza
item.description:
ME Trilogy is nowhere near 2013 release…

ArmA’s nowhere near GOTY state…

So yeah, for me the struggle is clearly between Black Flag and DayZ.

AC lets me sneak around scaring people shitless… DayZ lets me drop all my clothes…
Tough fight…

I’m not one for dropping my clothes, so DayZ’s got the survival thing to it here…

A fight too tough.
Aw, fuck it, DayZ’s not release, but Early Access.

Assassin’s Creed IV: Black Flag for me.

Read full topic

item.title: What's your 2013 GOTY?
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
Jack Freeman:

I guess you haven’t played it, or you would know that there is enough to justify it being a new game, but the price is ridiculous (glad I got it for half-off)

I got it free with my new GPU. It just feels like what BF3 SHOULD have been. Same game, but with a slew of improvements that had no right not to be in the first game, oh and with a lot more bugs. Except for the whole levolution thing, which looks cool and all, but is mostly just a poor gimmicky excuse of dynamic environments. BF3 was a 110 dollar game retail (DLC+preorder). So why the hell should we be expected to pay another 110 for a sequel that fails to innovate? Expecially when 15-30 dollar games may not be outshining it in pure content, but sure as hell are outshining it in innovation and gameplay. I picked up Contagion for $3.74 and it’s a much more fun game than BF4.

Read full topic

item.title: What's your 2013 GOTY?
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
garrthbarrttinn:

Really grasping at straws here, because I wasn’t terrifically impressed with anything 2013 had to offer;
Contagion.
It’s still in beta, so it’s not really even a 2013 game, but it’s honestly the only new thing all year that I’ve really liked. It’s an extremely tense and dynamic experience. Which, imo, is the secret to horror’s future in video games. Even just a taste of the dynamic makes something twice as scary (AKA; what Amnesia needs). In Contagion, there’s a really good FFA mode where the start off the round is a scavenge for the good weapons where you desperately hope you don’t run into anyone, and the rest is hunting eachother while the horde encircles you. The zombies swarm gunshots in a way that’ feels really organic. And you can hunt fellow survivors by watching where the zombies are walking. Good stuff.

Infinite was cool, but the gameplay was sorely lacking.

Kinda a bad year in gaming imo. Deadspace series finally gave up on being fun, BF4 released unfinished and not justifiably changed from its predecessor (how the hell did they not finish it? It’s not even that different), steam living room experience was announced, but hasn’t dropped yet and there’s, as expected, no news on the HL3 front, and all the other AAA’s failed to impress. Assassins Creed got beaten like the dead horse it is one more time alongside the other dead horse CoD, GTAV hasn’t come to PC, Tomb Raider sold out to the ADD action advetnure crowd (better than Underworld at least, which was on the opposite side of boring beyond believe, get your damn pacing right Square Enix), not sure what else to bitch about. Guess I haven’t seen any really good 15-30 dollar MP titles drop recently except GOTY Contagion. (the best games IMO are always in this category).

Whoa this is like a Neogaf post I can actually reply to.

Read full topic
